intro: Polycardia phyllanthoides, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. It is a climbing or trailing plant that can be grown as a houseplant or in gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its sweet scent and evergreen foliage.
